deduction_content: Knees not bent to form a 90-degree angle
Feet not parallel and shoulder-width apart

questions.question: What is the error code for Mǎ Bù (Horse Stance)?
What are the main deduction points for Mǎ Bù?
questions.answer: Deductions are applied when: 1) Knees are not bent to form a 90-degree angle, 2) Knees are not aligned with toes, 3) Feet are not parallel and shoulder-width apart, 4) Back is not straight.

questions.question: What is the correct knee position in Mǎ Bù?
questions.answer: The knees should be bent to form a 90-degree angle and aligned with the toes.

questions.question: How should the feet be positioned in Mǎ Bù?
questions.answer: The feet should be parallel and shoulder-width apart.

questions.question: Why is this stance called 'Horse Stance'?
questions.answer: Because the position resembles sitting on a horse, with legs apart and knees bent.
